intro: Aerva ruspolii, commonly known as the African sandbur, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces dry, wind-dispersed seeds enclosed in spiny burs, which aid in its propagation across sandy and disturbed soils. It thrives in dry conditions and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Aerva ruspolii is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor environments and is resistant to drought.
